titles.title: To provide an exemption from certain import prohibitions.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

bill.summary: 3/5/1998--Introduced. Exempts gum arabic and other byproducts from the prohibition on the import of products from Sudan if during the preceding calendar year: (1) more than 40 percent of the unprocessed gum arabic imported into the United States was attributable to crops cultivated in Sudan, including crops imported from countries other than source countries for gum arabic; or (2) a supply of the unprocessed articles of equal quality to that cultivated in Sudan and not attributable to Sudan is not available to supply more than 40 percent of the U.S. import market.
